full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/18/2023 Form -215B (Rev. 4-1-68) UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE RECORD OF SWORN STATEMENT IN AFFIDAVIT FORM AFFIDAVIT IN RE: Wing Hong WONG FILE NO. A17 210 251 EXECUTED AT Los Angeles, California DATE 10/22/68 Before the following officer of the U.S. Immigration and Naturalization Service: Loyd Le Netherlin, Investigator in the Chinese language. Interpreter J. He Moy used. I, Wing Hong WONG acknowledge that the above-named officer has identified himself to me as an officer of the United States Immigration and Naturalization Service, authorized by law to administer oaths and take testimony in connection with the enforcement of the Immigration and Nationality laws of the United States. He has informed me that he desires to take my sworn statement regarding: my right to be and rennin in the United States He has told me that my statement must be freely and voluntarily given and has advised me of these rights: "You have the right to remain silent. Anything you say can be used against you in court, or in any immigration or administrative proceeding. You have the right to talk to a lawyer for advice before we ask you any questions and to have him with you during questioning. If you cannot afford a lawyer, one will be appointed for you before any questioning if you wish. If you decide to answer questions now without a lawyer present, you will still have the right to stop answering at any time. You also have the right to stop answering at any time until you talk to a lawyer." I am willing to make a statement without anyone else being present. I swear that I will tell the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth, so help me, God. Being duly sworn, I make the following statement: My name is Wing Hong WONG. I live at 1514 Murray Circle, Los Angeles, Calif. 90026. I own and operate a grocery at 3733 Halldale Ave., Los Angeles, California. I was born on 8/4/22 at Shiu Chew Village, TSD., China and I am a citimen of China. I was admitted to the United States at San Pedro, Celifornia on 9/13/34 as a United States citizen. I was admitted as the citizen son of WONG SICK HONG. WONG SICK HONG is my blood father. He was in the United States as a native born United States citisen. I had believed I was a eitisen of the United States until recently because I had never been told anything but that my father was born in the United States. Last year I applied for a ciertificate of citisenship and since then I have ob ained information from my mother and from other people that my father was
